title: Capstone: Build an AI Risk Management Plan
description: Apply all four core functions of the AI RMF to a realistic AI system. You'll work through GOVERN, MAP, MEASURE, and MANAGE to produce a structured risk management plan.

systemOptions.name: MedAssist — AI Diagnostic Support System
systemOptions.description: An AI system that analyzes medical images (X-rays, MRIs) to flag potential abnormalities for radiologist review. Used in hospitals and outpatient clinics. Trained on data from 15 academic medical centers.

systemOptions.name: TalentMatch — AI Resume Screening System
systemOptions.description: An AI system that screens job applications, ranks candidates, and recommends a shortlist for human recruiters. Used by a Fortune 500 company across all departments. Uses a third-party NLP model fine-tuned on historical hiring data.

systemOptions.name: AutoDeliver — Autonomous Delivery Robot Fleet
systemOptions.description: A fleet of sidewalk delivery robots that autonomously navigate urban environments to deliver packages. Uses computer vision, LIDAR, and path planning algorithms. Deployed in 3 pilot cities.

steps.title: Step 1: GOVERN — Establish Governance
steps.description: Define the governance structure and policies for your chosen AI system.

fields.label: What organizational policies need to be in place? (GOVERN 1)
fields.hint: Consider legal requirements, trustworthy AI integration, risk tolerance processes, and monitoring schedules.

fields.label: Who is responsible and accountable? Define roles. (GOVERN 2)
fields.hint: Think about executive leadership, technical teams, compliance, and training needs.

fields.label: How will you ensure diverse perspectives? (GOVERN 3)
fields.hint: Consider team composition, human-AI oversight policies, and inclusion of impacted communities.

fields.label: How will you foster a risk-aware culture? (GOVERN 4)
fields.hint: Think about safety-first mindset, documentation practices, incident sharing.

fields.label: Who are your key external stakeholders and how will you engage them? (GOVERN 5)
fields.hint: Consider end users, impacted communities, regulators, advocacy groups.

fields.label: What third-party risks exist and how will you address them? (GOVERN 6)
fields.hint: Consider third-party data, models, software, and IP risks.

steps.title: Step 2: MAP — Establish Context and Identify Risks
steps.description: Document the context, categorize the system, and characterize potential impacts.

fields.label: Describe the intended purpose, users, and deployment context. (MAP 1)
fields.hint: Include expected users, settings, legal considerations, and risk tolerance.

fields.label: How would you categorize this AI system? (MAP 2)
fields.hint: What type of model? What are its knowledge limits? How is output overseen?

fields.label: What are the expected benefits and potential costs? (MAP 3)
fields.hint: Consider both monetary and non-monetary costs, including from errors.

fields.label: What third-party components are involved and what risks do they introduce? (MAP 4)
fields.hint: Consider data sources, pre-trained models, cloud services, APIs.

fields.label: Identify and characterize potential impacts. (MAP 5)
fields.hint: Think about impacts to individuals, groups, communities, organizations, and ecosystems. Rate likelihood and magnitude.

steps.title: Step 3: MEASURE — Define Metrics and Evaluation
steps.description: Select metrics, define TEVV processes, and plan risk tracking.

fields.label: What metrics will you use for each trustworthiness characteristic? (MEASURE 1)
fields.hint: Consider validity, safety, security, transparency, explainability, privacy, and fairness metrics.

fields.label: Describe your TEVV approach. (MEASURE 2)
fields.hint: How will you test before deployment? What about ongoing monitoring? Who performs independent review?

fields.label: How will you track risks over time? (MEASURE 3)
fields.hint: Consider emergent risks, end user feedback mechanisms, and hard-to-measure risks.

fields.label: How will you assess whether your measurements are effective? (MEASURE 4)
fields.hint: Consider domain expert consultation, deployment context validation, and documented improvements.

steps.title: Step 4: MANAGE — Plan Risk Treatment
steps.description: Prioritize risks and develop response, monitoring, and communication plans.

fields.label: Prioritize your top 5 risks and assign response strategies. (MANAGE 1)
fields.hint: For each risk: mitigate, transfer, avoid, or accept. Document residual risks.

fields.label: How will you maximize benefits while minimizing negative impacts? (MANAGE 2)
fields.hint: Consider non-AI alternatives, mechanisms to sustain value, procedures for unknown risks, and disengagement criteria.

fields.label: How will you manage third-party risks on an ongoing basis? (MANAGE 3)
fields.hint: Regular monitoring, pre-trained model tracking, applying risk controls.

fields.label: Describe your post-deployment monitoring and incident response plan. (MANAGE 4)
fields.hint: Include monitoring mechanisms, user feedback capture, incident communication, change management, and continual improvement.
